Reviews.Title: “Not only a hight tower, hight quality and service as well”
Reviews.Author: JAUrlaub
Reviews.Content: The Hotel between three very nice towers just amazing to see, very clossed to the Airport, and 5 minute walk from the Metro-Station, Taxis are available at the frond of the Hotel. Staff is very nice, attantative, courteouse, friendly and fast, all information needed was given in a very professional way. Very great rooms : large, bright and well appointed, very creative solutions for the bathroom. Breakfast is very good, my favorit coffee "Espresso" here is it possible to get a perfect one. Also for those like me who like to relax after work health club has top-class gym/steam room/sauna !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: IMcouple
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely deserves its rating. Impeccable service, food, and accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “If it's good enough Barcelona FC...”
Reviews.Author: Checkers340
Reviews.Content: It's good enough for me. I have stayed at this hotel numerous times for work and it never lets me down like Messi in The Champions League. Hands down the best showers in Europe. Four in-room light settings for all moods. Fantastic service. Highly recommend eating at the restaurant, located on level 30 with a stunning panoramic view of Madrid. Only drawback is the best location but everything you need is in the hotel. Metro is nearby - about 10 stops to the old town.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel - great value”
Reviews.Author: Star556
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a recent leisure trip. I was aware it was slightly out of town but was prepared to stay further out for a better hotel and this is exactly what we got. Because of the excellent metro system in madrid - it makes the hotel very accessible and it really is only a 15 min metro ride into downtown. The area is a business district and is clean and well maintained. The nearest metro station Bolgna is a 5 minute walk as you turn left out of the hotel. Here you will also find a hopsital and a mcdonalds with their own cafe which we availed for breakfast - great coffee and pastries ! After a couple of hiccups with our room first being a broken tap and the second being a leaking shower, we were kindly upgraded to a junior suite for 2 nights of our stay. Rooms are very comfortable and classy with dark wooden flooring and gorgeous bathrooms with great city views. Found room service to be ridiculously priced ( probably because of the euro ) so mainly ate out. *Tips Nearest station is Bologna as you turn left out of hotel onto main road. If you turn right onto main road there is a small shop at a 5min walk where you can by drinks, water, confectionery cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Cheekyff_2728
Reviews.Content: Excellent service with modern contemporary design. Hotel is nested about 20minutes from the city centre by the metro. Neighbourhood is clean, quiet and nice. Very good value paid for a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jesssssssss
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights during our break to Madrid. It is well worthy of it's 5 stars. The attention to detail was excellent throughout our stay especially the chocolates and weather forecast that we received every night on our pillows. The bathroom was extremely different, I loved it!! I would definately recommend this hotel to others visiting Madrid and it is located beside the metro which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: M V
Reviews.Content: Totally clean, comfortable and spacious bedrooms... beds were great especially in size :) :) very modern decor. Great spa with terrific views while relaxing you need to try, small but very complete gym enough for me. Staff helpful and the hotel restaurant at the top of the building has great and beautiful views. Repeated the experience twice and will do so again so i do recommend it the location is just a bit far from city center but plenty of taxi's available outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: YsabelMontilla
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that the hotel is beautiful, comfortable, and the room is amazing and clean. I would not recommend the restaurant, the food is not impressive, I went to a massage and i really didn't like it, plus that the hotel do not have a pool, I understand is a business hotel in general but they also offer the package of honey moon, so what do you do inside the hotel?? they have an amazing jacuzzi in the Spa but you can only use it for 30 minutes and the showers (in the Spa) are in terrible condition. When i arrived the guys in front desk were really kind, but the next morning we called to verify the check out time and it was informed 1:30pm, but at 12:20 one lady from front desk asked us to get out of the room at this moment (it wasn't a five star service).

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: aa a
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever been in Madrid. Great service from all the staff, attention to detail, great breakfast, amazing views, clean, great for business. Not right in the centre of Madrid but it is worth it. I really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Luv_a_beach27
Reviews.Content: This high-rise hotel was very nice. It has a classy, modern style. Very comfortable beds and plenty of space. My husband and I stayed here during one of his business trips so it was a little outside of the Old Town Madrid city. There were no problems getting transportation into and around the city. The location is near the Chamartin train station where you can take the Renfe or Metro. Use the metro to get around, it is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: DAYTRIPPER63_9
Reviews.Content: Really nice Hotel, its a bit outside the city centre about a 30 minutes to Sol Metro Station which is Central Madrid, but easy enough journey, if you where visiting the Bernabeu its only 5 stops away about 5 minutes on the Metro and your there...So if your going for the match or to just do the tour its close enough to do. to get to the hotel from the Airport its line 8 to Nuevos Ministerios, then head one floor down to Line 10 for Bergona (last station on this line will be Hospital Infanta Sofia, as the metro pulls into the platform you might see Tres Olivas on the front of the metro this is fine its the right train you are on, if you get on and not sure you are going in the right direction the first station you will come to is the Santiago Bernabeu ( metro station for Real Madrids Football Ground ) Bergona is only 4 stops away, when you get off the Metro head to the left for the exit to the Madrid Towers as if you go right you will end up on the otherside of a 6 lane highway, so just head left off the train its a few minutes walk to the exit..You will see the hotel as there are about 4 towers and the Eurostars Madrid is in the middle, set back abit but just walk towards the towers, you cross one main road then it is all a pedestrial area, reall easy..Rooms where very nice we stayed on the 18th floor, reception staff very helpful, Breakfast is served on the 30th floor so you have a nice view. The staff serving breakfast where excellent and always happy to serve and there was a great deal of choice. The Spa was around 29 euros and you booked it through the main reception, you can have a DVD player installed in your room but you need to arrange this before your visit, if you look on the map it is quite a distance outside the centre but with the metro station so close its so easy to get in and you will be guarenteed a great nights sleep as there is no noise. Would happily stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great views, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julian B
Reviews.Content: This is not a city centre location, but the hotel makes up for this in quality, service and some amazing views of Madrid. It is surprisingly easy to get to and makes a great base for a business trip or holiday with a lovely spa. Would definitely stay again...

Reviews.Title: “good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: RudifromBelgium
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay a couple of nights for business purposes. The rooms are very comfortable, equipped with very good beds and hightech lights and floor to ceiling window blinds. The windows can be opened to let some fresh air enter the room. The staff was very helpfull and most of them were very fluent in english, what cannot be said from the other people working in restaurants/bars around the hotel. Conveniently located between Barajas airport and the city center.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Long Branch, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “Romantic surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria V
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked us a room with their romantic packet and it more than surpassed our expectations! He is a local and I have visited Madrid many times so no reason to get a hotel but a romantic gesture on his part! The room was devine....a luxury experience from the amazing bathroom to controlling the lights and blinds from your own bed. We did have to wait for our room originally, our fault, and they gave us free drinks at the bar to pass the time. After a nice dinner we came back to beds turned down, a liter of cava and strawberries dipped in chocolate, truffles and other chocolate treats! The breakfast buffet was extensive and we felt every extra penny was worth it! Late check out in the deal was also a plus because we went back and relaxed after breakfast! Would return a million times if I could! Definitely a good way to get away in a place not far from home!

Reviews.Title: “No hot water and 20 minutes to check out”
Reviews.Author: Pukkel
Reviews.Content: This was my first and last stay in this hotel. The hotel tower itself is impressive enough and so is the room design. And when you're high up, the views are incredible. Staff is friendly enough and most of them speak good English for Spanish standards. The 135 Euro room rate was also fair enough. Dealbreakers for me: No hot water in the morning. Only ice cold water. Other than "sorry" no solution or compensation offered. I could not take a shower or wash properly and had to shave with ice cold water. Only to end up with a 20 minute wait for checkout. The checkout desk was fully staffed (4 people) at 7:45am but it takes between 5 and 10 minutes for each guest to check out and I had at least 10 people in front of me and the line quickly grew to about 20 behind me with aggravated business people like myself under pressure to get to their meetings. Unacceptable for a 5-star hotel and there are far better options available in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced folly”
Reviews.Author: Simon P
Reviews.Content: Nice looking hotel but that's where it ends. Stayed here over the weekend 26/27 Feb, rooms and view are good, air-conditioning stuck on the hottest setting, cannot turn down! Room is like a sauna, have to open all windows to be able to sleep. Oh by the way they are permanently locked so you have to break them to open them. National football team is also staying here and on returning to hotel we are told we cannot enter!! Staff treat us like dirt and tell us to walk round the back to get inside, by the way that door is locked as well. In the end bang on fire door until security open it. Ask us what is room number - tell him to get lost before I treat him to Glasgow handshake. Stay somewhere else where they treat you like a guest, at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice buisness hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marc D
Reviews.Content: Very Nice modernly designed rooms, Nice view over tbs city Breakfest at sunrise is recommended Poor location if you want to be near downtown Madrid Mainly buisness hotel Friendly staf and Nice Spa

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ladybugged
Reviews.Content: You could say we were very lucky because we stayed in two different rooms during the same trip. First, our skyline room on the 27th floor was absolutely fabulous, and very comfortable. The views were amazing and the added detail with the complementary luxury chocolates and drinks being delivered about half an hour after we checked in were a special touch that added to the already pleasing and very friendly service. However, there was some sort of droning noise which I noticed throughout the night that was particularly bothersome so we exchanged rooms to a junior suite. This is where I was left speechless! The suite was superb, true 5* luxury and absolutely faultless. I particularly loved the bathing area and underfloor heating. The restaurant was beautiful and food perfect; again the staff were attentive and very professional.. We enjoyed the spa late in the evening which made the panoramic views different again with the city lights twinkling below. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and the friendly staff helped make a city break truly amazing. The hotel is right next to the best underground/ metro I have ever used and taxis are fairly priced if you can force yourself to venture out of this fab hotel once you have checked in!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic conference venue and a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: David98
Reviews.Content: Regularly stay here for business; used it recently (late November) to host a 100 + head conference. Rooms excellent; views are astonishing; service good; location good; bar and public areas dramatic and welcoming. Conference team delivered exceptional serivce and value. It is a premium product at a very good price point , and better than that it is just a great place to stay.Highly reccomended

Reviews.Title: “A great business hotel with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: FlanFam11
Reviews.Content: On the north end of Paseo Castellana, this hotel (one of the 4 towers that dominate the skyline of northern Madrid) is well situated for access to all the main roads out of Madrid and still close enough to get the Metro into the city. It is very easy to get to and from Barajas Airport via the toll road. The breakfast is excellent with a huge buffet spread to suit virtually all tastes (ask for an omelette and you won't be disappointed either), however room service food is one area that doesn't match the 5* rating. There is a panoramic restaurant on the top floor that serves better local and spanish regional dishes. The gym is basic but sufficient for a short stay, didn't try the spa! Staff generally are very well trained and helpful, most speak two or more languages. The bar is eye wateringly expensive for basic drinks - so plan your nights out in one of Madrids' many excfellent independant restaurants. All the rooms have free wifi and it is quite fast so no issues with working/staying in touch with the office. This isn't a very child friendly hotel so it's not really suitable for family breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Value/Service”
Reviews.Author: westender
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a couple of times and found it to be clean,efficient and cheap (for what you get). Rooms are large and wifi is on demand throughout the hotel. No need to keep logging in. Breakfast buffet is great quality + great views. It's not very central but if you're on business in the area it's peerless . enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Not quite there”
Reviews.Author: northgap
Reviews.Content: A tall striking tower outside of the main city, this hotel tries to place itself amongst the elite. In the effort, it becomes a contrast of right and wrong. The rooms are modern, chic and reasonable spacious. Yet they fail on a number of fronts. Too few towels, towel heaters that don't work, lights that are more cool than functional. Also, not sure what the point is about the ability to open the bathroom, via levered panels, to the rest of the room. As to the service, again a plague of inconsistencies. Ice takes two requests the first time but shows up in 3 minutes the second. A request to make a dinner reservation with a call back confirmation fails completely but the second request is promptly honored. A request for coffee in the morning fails for reasons reasonable only to those failing to deliver. This is a hotel that aspires to be a top class one but seems to not grasp the regrettable contrast of style over substance.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing building, very well appointed room, but 'meh' quality breakfast and many hairs in bathtub”
Reviews.Author: stubby_galavant
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this absolutely beautiful to see and enter hotel last week. The room and entry facilities were fabulous, views lovely, rooms very well appointed. Two bad issues tempered my enthusiasm: the breakfast food was not the quality i would have expected (but the 30th floor restaurant had great service and view!); worse, the bathtub had a lot of shall we say thick black hairs that was *not* cool.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: AlkiGreece
Reviews.Content: Expensive but worth it! We stayed at the top floor, we had a junior suite interconnecting with a double room. Great views, excellent service, wonderful bathroom, stereo system, great foor and room service. Breakfast had a wide variety of food, nothing was missing I think. A small disadvantage is that there is only one restaurant if you want to dine in the hotel, and it's extremely expensive. Finally, cleanliness in the room could be better. All in all, I would love to return to this hotel. All in my family loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, imposing building”
Reviews.Author: Los T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly the type of hotel I like; modern, clean, contemporary. The quality is clear, its well thought-out and has some lovely features. The value for money it offers is incredible. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFRA
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by this business hotel in the Quatro Torres Business Area. The service was excellent, the room was clean, spacious and with a nice view over Madrid. If you stay here please book breakfast, too. It really pays off as there is so much variety. I did not got to go to the spa but I hear it is very good, too. The only minus is that if you are visiting as a tourist the hotel is a good 30 minutes from the city centre (Sol). There is a metro station very close and a bus stop is right next to the hotel, though.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel - great if the location suits you”
Reviews.Author: Oriel100
Reviews.Content: Visited on business for a couple on nights in November. The standard hotel rooms are modern, smart, and reasonable spacious. Everything about it is quite trendy/modern - subdued (or dim, depending upon your take) lighting in the reception and corridors. I reminded me of the W hotels in the US in a number of respects. The food in the main restaurant was good - breakfast particularly so, which was a cut above most hotel buffet breakfasts. The location was fine for me, as it was a business trip, but I'm not sure it would be so good for a touristy Madrid visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Alexandralves
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and renovated. The rooms are big, the bedroom too. The view it´s very nice, especially from the restaurant in the top. The breakfast was amazing, very nice buffet. The hotel it´s 10min away from the city center (Puerta del Sol) but I liked the flowing traffic, road and parking in Madrid, so it´s not very difficult to reach the main points by car. There´s also many taxis around. Check in and check out it´s fast and eficient. Staff is great. It´s also much cheaper than similar hotels (like Villa Magna).

Reviews.Title: “5 stars, but no soul and lack of atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Garzagul
Reviews.Content: Indeed the hotel is at a great location, at the end of Castillana avenue, close to all urban highways, 30 floors of marble and glass, very clean, large rooms, all possible amenities but... to deserve 5 stars an hotel has to give you a special feeling, something that you do not retrieve somewhere else, that makes you remember the place. For me, it will not be the case of Eurostar tower !

Reviews.Title: “Highly overrated hotel”
Reviews.Author: KaticaWarsaw
Reviews.Content: Eurostars is a landmark fo Madrid.One of the very few sky scrapers in Madrid. It is very hightech. Rooms are overdone in terms of hightech.For 5star it lacks supplies in the bathroom, proper ironing desk(something funny on standard equipment), proper AC (it was or too cold or too warm), English channels on TV. Service is rather avarage. Staff in the restaurant mastered the art of avoiding eye contact - no chance to get they attention.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous view!”
Reviews.Author: Rakipova
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel!!!!!! Fantastic staff!!!! Fantastic atmosphere!!!! Absolutely stunning view!!!!!!! A true 5* property. Loved the stay, loved the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “great, as usual”
Reviews.Author: jmmorgadinho
Reviews.Content: This hotel is always a good choice if you want to stay at a 5 star hotel with 4 star prices. The rooms are huge and clean, with wooden floors (which is always a clean, preference of mine - no carpets...). The breakfast on the 30th floor has got to have the best view in town, and the food choice is endless. I have stayed here in the past 2 years and will continue staying as long as this level of quality is kept

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanSurv
Reviews.Content: Brand new, so everything works, including the wireless, which worked without a flaw. Nice views from the rooms, great views from the restaurant. Lots of friendly staff everywhere. It's fairly close to the airport but a bit outside the city. Took me about 25 minutes in a taxi to get into the city center at about 09.00. You can't walk out the door to the sights of Madrid, but you can retire to a great place when you have been there. I was there on business but would also go with slightly bigger kids who don't mind being out for a whole day, my kids at 8 and 12 would love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very stilish hotel outside the city center but very close to the metro station”
Reviews.Author: DaMaTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very modern and stilish one. The room are very spacious, the bathroom fantastic. The view from the rooms is stunning: you can see all Madrid! The restaurant is in the 30th floor, so the view is lovely there too. The hotel is a bit outside the city centre, but the metro station is just in 2 minutes walk distance and brings you in about 25 minutes in the centre (one way ticket EUR 1.50; 10 ticket cards EUR 9.30, highly raccomended if you're staying several days and plan to visit the city), which is very handy, most of all because there is a metro every tre minutes (during the week even every minute). The breakfast buffet is pretty good. The service in the whole hotel is very friendly. The room service is also very good and the food pretty nice as well. The pillow are not very high, so if you're used to sleep with a nice fluffy pillow this could prove a bit unconfortable. It is recommendable as a hotel for business trip or for couple, but not necessarily for families.

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel but inferior location”
Reviews.Author: ClientServiceExpert
Reviews.Content: It's luxury designed, well functioning hotel. Its big disadvantage is its location, its huge advantage is its (relatively) low price so overall value for money is good. Location: far from center, it’s somewhat half way between airport and center so far from ideal for tourism purposes but can be OK for business View: high floor has nice view Ambience: hotel is more geared for business travelers. It has a nice lobby bar on the -1 floor with few nice corners allowing private talks Room: very modern, spacious, nicely decorated Service: very good and professional. When it was raining, the hotel had umbrellas for all guests. Reception knowledgeable about what-to-dos in Madrid Cleanness: very

Reviews.Title: “superb!”
Reviews.Author: pinevalleyTR
Reviews.Content: my stay here was fantastic! great rooms(very clean and well equipped), fantastic views of the city, convenient location(near the bologne metro stop and only 10 mins away from town by taxi) nice bathrooms(modern, good size and very clean). special praises to Samuel who works at the front desk! Great check-in experience; very friendly, good manners, professional! one thing I wasnt so happy about was the attitude of the house keeping personnel. They seemed moody and negative all the time. Other than that had a great time staying at this place will definitely return and suggest to others.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to go back and to recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: ana s
Reviews.Content: I visit Madrid on business quite regularly and have always stayed at this hotel. We have also held a couple of corporate events/cocktail for clients and have been very satisfied with the service, the catering options, the willingness to accommodate our needs and the attention to detail. The breakfast option and venue is superb. I have also used the Spa which is quite unique in terms of the views and privacy. Location wise is excellent as well, easy to get in and out of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.Top choice for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Murgia78
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, I definitely recommend this hotel as one of the best in town

Reviews.Title: “Modern hi-tech hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMmd
Reviews.Content: This is a modern 30 floor hotel, 15 min from the airport. You will need to get a taxi or the metro to get to the city centre. The hotel is fairly new and the design is largely excellent. Sometimes some of the facilities are not intuitive on how they should be used. When considering the hi-tech nature of this hotel I expected more from the TV system which has very limited English coverage. Internet is free throughout the hotel. Although I would happily stay here again, if I was coming as a tourist I would try and find a more central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hi-tech hotel”
Reviews.Author: barrylk
Reviews.Content: It took under 30 minutes from the airport by Metro to the nearby Begona station. As we walked towards the Hotel, fountains in a variety of colours cascaded in front of this landmark huge building. This hotel is as near to a five star american hotel as you can get. A choice of six lifts swiftly transport you to your room. The rooms are ultra modern. A control panel next to the bed adjusts the lighting to several settings and opens and closes the window blinds. A flat TV screen with countless TV channels available, underfloor heating in the bathroom,air conditioning, multi nozzle shower sytem all contribute to a thoroughly modern facility. Tribunal metro station is only 20 minutes away where one can visit numerous restaurants and bars and the Grand Via. We paid under 80 Euros for one night and it was absolutely excellent value for the money we paid

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced !”
Reviews.Author: banquetmonster
Reviews.Content: a) No 'Shuttle Bus' for the Airport. Taxi Fare to Barajas, Terminal #4 was approx. 30 Euros. This was double the cost of a Taxi to Plaza de Colon. Same distance. b) Volvoreta Restaurant not opening until 8.30pm. Could benefit from an earlier opening at say 7.00pm ; possibly losing foreign guests going out to eat externally ? c) Spa treatments ridicuously over priced, even by London Spa standards. d) No 'Movie' Channel Service on offer. The great points are ..... a) Excellent King Size Beds. b) Good Basement Bar c) Excellent service from ALL Staff

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: clams5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business - modern design, including the hallways where most hotels cut corners. The bathrooms are really cool, beds are comfortable, staff is professional. I would definitely stay here again, and I agree this is one of the best hotels in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “High Tech, contemporary and trendy”
Reviews.Author: Malim27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for couple of nights on business. Located on Castellana in the centre of Madrid, a short cab ride but long walk from all the action around Plaza Mayor. On arrival, the front of the building was a sea of diplomatic cars, an instant sign of the type of people who stay in a place like this – purportedly the ‘beautiful’ people. Indeed, the contemporary surroundings in a huge, modern tower seemed to ooze wealth and status, good if you like that sort of thing. Check in was quick and efficient and I was in my room within 10 minutes on the 9th floor. Room is very spacious and cool looking, probably due to the ambient lighting and wooden floors. A separate shower (super high-tec with nozzles all over the place to ensure you drown comfortably), WC and bath made for a relaxing stay. Electric blinds and lighting which you can change to any setting with an array of bedside switches added to the luxury feel (the place is 5 stars) if a little daunting to non-technology types. Nevertheless, after a few practice turns of the various knobs, its easy to get the hang of. Room also included a safe and be warned, an expensive mini bar (aren’t they all?). Breakfast is included in the rate and was of high quality, ample choice of everything, plus a great view from the top floor (30th) restaurant. Bar downstairs one level below reception was very nice with a huge selection of cocktails and nice nibbles. Usual choice of bar food was always available, but I didn’t sample this. In summary, a nice place to stay. Ok location, good value for money, but the ultra contemporary feel may not be to everyone’s taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Niels_Maaike_NL
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights for an indoor training. The rooms where absolutely wonderful and it was one of the nicest beds I've ever slept in. For the training everything was set up as requested and if there was anything we needed, Lucia was always there for us. The lunch buffet was absolutely superb and we could never complain that there was not enough because they kept bringing more if we finished a plate. Breakfast was also extensive and with a lovely view and sunrise over Madrid. Location wise it might not be in the city centre, however you can be there in a quick taxi or metro ride. For us it was very convenient because the Spanish office of our company was located in one of the other towers next door. So all in all a very nice stay with outstanding service from all staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: PaulF71
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a general business hotel, on the edge of the city. A short taxi ride to the centre. What makes this a good hotel is a few things:- 1. The Bathroom/Wet room is very good, the shower is like a tropical downpour and pleasantly assaults your body from many different angels. 2. The views from the 38th floor restaurant and from the higher placed rooms are great. 3. The price, at 90 Euros a night it's a bargain of the highest order.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: xevialde
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable. Maybe somehow far from center city if not by taxi. Outstanding breakfast from the 30th floor while sightseeing Madrid (even if that is not saying much)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views and good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Dutch_TA
Reviews.Content: Before you drive into Madrid you see the hotel from a distance, a very nice looking skyscraper. The check in went very smoothly, and the reception staff was very friendly and they immediately make you feel welcome. Before we even noticed, the doormen wanted to park our car into their parking garage and take care of the luggage. Very good service right from the beginning. The lady at the reception was very kind and interested in our journey and we had immediately a good conversation with her. After check in she showed us the room that was on the 27th floor as we booked a skyline room. As we booked a Madrid card arrangement she told we could get a free welcome drink in the bar that was very much welcomed. The room was very nice and superb clean. It had all the features you would expect from a five star hotel. The design was very beautiful and the bed looked very comfortable from the beginning and did gave us a good night rest. There was nothing to complain about the room. The first evening we ate at the restaurant that was on the top floor and gave some breathtaking views over the city. As we didn't reserve a table there was no view for us but anyway we were very happy we could eat that late on the evening. The food was good but not fantastic but at least it tasted good. The service in the restaurant was mediocre. To many people serving one table and so they asked a few times if we wanted bread what we didn't want and let the first waiter know. But anyway, better 3 waiters at your table as no one. The bar at the first floor was good looking and you could also enjoy sitting outside for some drinks. The wine served was of good quality and served with potato ships. The bar man (Vladimir) is very professional and you could see he very much enjoys his job. The bar was almost empty but he did everything very fast and with much profession. We had a great time with Vladimir, as it was so quiet he had some time for a conversation with us that we started our own. Thank you for that ! The breakfast was also on the top floor and had also breathtaking views. The food was from very good quality and there was plenty of choice for every bodies needs. From smoothies to warm dishes, you name it and they have it. Coffee, tea and fresh orange juice was served right after taking place. The second day at breakfast they already knew they should serve one coffee for me and tea for my wife with both orange juice. That seemed all employees had their 5 star service level. A big plus was the free internet with computer in the lobby, that was also very fast. A service that is hard to find these days. Some reviewers complain about the location but my wife and I found the location very good as we didn't want a hotel in the middle of the city centre. Also on the website they don't give you the imagination it is in the centre so everybody could have known it was not close to the city centre. So why complaining about the location, just do your homework. The subway is a 2 minute walk away, is in a safe surrounding and didn't cost that much money at all. We very much enjoyed our stay at the Eurostar hotel and we definitely would love to come back when we visit Madrid again. We can highly recommend this hotel to others who like perfect service, great rooms and descent prices.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for a 2star Hotel, and get a 5star Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tonysenior
Reviews.Content: You always have choices when you select a hotel, in Madrid the choice is either you can get a 2star hotel in a prime location, or you can sacrifice some of the location and get a 5star hotel in a less attractive location, I find that Eurostar lives up to the international 5star hotel rating, so in other words Eurostar is a genuine 5star hotel, it’s very clean, modern, and the staff are courteous and helpful in any way, the train ride to the city center is about 15 minutes, so in conclusion, if you are on a budget, or if you want the 5star experience for a 2star price, and if you are willing to travel 15minutes by metro to get to the city center, then this Hotel is the right place for you. Note: I really enjoyed my stay here, and I will stay here again, the next time I visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING 5* HOTEL!! BEST EVER”
Reviews.Author: Traveler071
Reviews.Content: Ignore these ridiculous poor comments, if you find this hotel to be poor (or even terrible) there really is no hope of finding a hotel you will like. The staff were amazing, English was very good better than expected. The lobby was fantastic and spotless, we were attended to immediately and were in our fantastic room with panoramic views within seconds! The room was spacious and fulfilled all requirements. The only problem was that the shower leaked, but maintenance fixed this at first mention. I will say that room service, restaurants and spa are quite expensive, but this is to be expected. We spent a lot of time in the city centre and ate there, returning at night to the beautiful fountains outside which are similar to (albeit smaller versions of) the magic fountains in Barcelona! All in all I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Madrid. Especially when you book it for the price we did (£290pp for 5 nights including flights from Heathrow for 2 people)

Reviews.Title: “Great Design & Breakfast with a Stunning View”
Reviews.Author: travelingchrissie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Eurostars Madrid Tower on business to attend a conference in the hotel. The entire hotel is of great design, I truely loved the room! The bathroom looks very pretty in dark colors, the shower is very modern and a lovely treat! All of the rooms offer nice views, the most beautiful is from the breakfast room on the 30th floor! The breakfast is really nice with a good selection from everything - Spanish and global delights. Loved the fruits and cheese selection. Conference facilities were good - food and drinks were excellent at all times. Only downside is the location - very far from central Madrid. They offer extremely attractive corporate rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay- a beautiful 5* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ninae123
Reviews.Content: We stayed due to a business trip that I had to attend on Thursday and Friday, but decided to stay for the wknd. My boyfriend booked 3 nights as he had heard and see the hotel and wanted to stay. We had a beautiful room - high up- great views of Madrid. Very modern, powerful shower and an abundance of toiletries. We loved the way you could see the views from the bathroom- very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's an 'expense account' hotel, but more too”
Reviews.Author: Calif_traveler_11
Reviews.Content: With services geared to the business traveler, the hotel looks and feels like an excellent 5-star hotel you'd find in any cosmopolitan city. The staff, from front desk to service, is polite, knowledgeable, willing to solve problems and get answers for all guests, whether tourist or business. After a month of touring Spain we wanted to end on a high note (the pun is intentional) and stay with a little luxury. The Towers - part of a larger, ultra-modern complex - showcases modern design and modern amenities. Everything works; air conditioning, water, lights, wifi, the comfortable bed. The view is exceptional from any of the upper floors. It's a 5-star hotel after all. Construction is still continuing behind the hotel, but there is no problem with noise in the hotel room. The towers are new to the city's skyline and signify Madrid's modern side. They are an impressive sight and can easily be seen from the train as you approach Atocha station. You are, however, some distance from the colorful center of the city and getting there will require a bus, cab or metro ride. The metro is fast, easy, avoids congestion and takes about 25 minutes to reach Plaza del Sol. The nearest metro stop is only a 3-5 minute walk from the hotel, along the edge of the tower complex and near a hospital. There are few restaurants nearby and the apartment buildings that line the wide, busy thoroughfare add little distinction to the area, giving a less appealing 'any big city in the world' feeling to a stay. That said, we had an excellent dinner at Casa Nemesio which is just a short walk from the hotel. And, frankly, after a month of travel, the Eurostars Madrid was a good place to unwind before the flight home. Check online for the best rates. If you want to be in the middle of things, check out hotels around the Plaza del Sol, for example, but if you're flying home soon, a stay here would be a relaxing finish.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a good deal on price, unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: Matthew085
Reviews.Content: We paid about £80 a night (no breakfast), for a three night break in this hotel, which to my mind was an excellent deal. As stated in my title, for this sort of price I think this hotel was a fantastic option for a holiday in Madrid. The hotel itself is in a large sky scrapper and has very modern furnishings at a 5* level. The standard room we were in should meet anyone's standards - superking-sized bed, floor to ceiling windows (with fantastic views if you can get a high floor), electric curtains and mood lighting (and I'd disagree with previous reviewers that these are especially difficult to operate), good shower, separate good sized bath (which unlike one previous reviewer we had no problem filling with hot water), and all the other trappings you would expect of a 5* hotel. The staff were very friendly and professional without being at all pretentious. The reception recommended and booked a restaurant for us at late notice on a Sunday evening which was just the sort of thing we were after, for which we were very grateful. The room cleaning and turndown service was also 5* standard. We didn't have breakfast, as €25 per person is too much to my mind and didn't use the spa, as this cost €29 per person (which to use a jacuzzi and sauna, which is all we would have wanted, is also I think unjustifiable). As mentioned in previous reviews, the catch for a tourist using this hotel is the location. However, it's only a c 10 minute journey on the (very cheap and pleasant) Metro or a €15 cab journey into town, so in my view if you can get the sort of price we got then the journey cost/time is a price worth paying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for the Business Traveler In Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Mobysan
Reviews.Content: Agree with pretty much all the comments I read about this hotel on Trip Advisor. A great 5 star business class hotel set in one of the four landmark glass towers that dominate the Madrid skyline with polite, courteous and efficient staff. Room was modern, clean and stylish , great design and gizmos with the various light settings and electric blackout blinds. Free and easily accessible wi-fi, (i.e.no fiddling around with codes and having to go down to reception to get it reset!). Excellent shower and big comfy bed and very quiet. All this for 103 Euros ! Have previously paid 30 euros more for poor "3-star" accomodation on several occasions albeit in a more central location - never again. Would rather stay here and catch a quick cab into the city. Breakfast was expensive at 25 Euros - but it was on the top floor with excellent panoramic views - and it was a very good spread of hot and cold dishes. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Design over substance and poor location”
Reviews.Author: JB30
Reviews.Content: A very business specifc hotel located some 5 miles from Madrid town with nothing in the local area. If you like tall modern designed buildings then this may appeal, but I think it was over priced and sacrificed cutting edge design for practicality. For example the lighting system has different mood settings but on entering in the room no lights turn on and the controls are hidden away. The bath didn't get any hot water so nobody uses it and the pipes were rusty so the water was brown. Breakfast was excellent though, but not worth £140 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: Jacob_Nu
Reviews.Content: Getting to the hotel was a little bit of a problem but after one round around the block we could get in. Signing could be better though. The receptionist was very helpfull and nice in checking in and guiding. Clear explanations etc where offered. Very good! The room was very nice. Reasonable size especially for city's. Room was very clean and everything you need was there. We had same problems with the airco but I got the feeling that it was a general policy of the hotel to limit airco capacity and save on energy costs. Not a big issue but the rooms was a bit on the warmer side. The lighting was the difficult issue. The have a very state of the art lighting system but they always become difficult to understand if there is no clear instruction on how it works. After a day we found that out by accident and from than it was ok. The day before we had to switch on all the lights in the room or all off. Ayway better instructions would help here. Some people might be bothered by the fact that the bathroom has a window that can not be 100% shut. That means you can always look into the bathroom also when the shutters are closed. We do not care but others might not be happy with this. Very positive here is a seperate shower. I always prefer to have a sperate shower instead of showering in the bathtub. The breakfast was very good. Buffet style and a very large choice. We had some problems with the hot items since they where not hot bit that problem was solved the next day. We also had some problem with ordering coffee but that was a lack in our Spanish. The English of the spanish is not so very good and many times not even present. That is a pitty. Anyway we managed. The parking cost extra but you get valet parking for that. The way to the centre is far but when getting into the Metro system you are there in no time and the distance to the center is no issue anymore.

Reviews.Title: “good for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Evgeny O
Reviews.Content: Good modern hotel with all necessary attributes for business travellers. Service is fine. Worth the money. The only and big problem - its location, if you are a turist. It is far away from city center, and most probably you will be spending lots of time in traffic jams on the way to main tourists destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheFlock1
Reviews.Content: The Madrid Tower is a great business hotel. The building itself is fantastic and the views are wonderful. The rooms are roomy, plush and ideal to do work if you need to. The location is good for business (close to the airport and many companies), but not good for tourists (not near any of the key sites). The breakfast buffet in the morning is perfect for a "power" breakfast. The business facilities are good. It is a great place to stay on business, but not ideal for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, except for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: aidavat
Reviews.Content: A nice big room in a modern hotel. The cleaningless was just about acceptable though. Overall good value except for 25 euro extra for the breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous high-tech skyscraper hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kapkanschikov
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hi-tech skyscraper hotel! We staid at 18th floor and could observe half of Madrid just out of the huge king-size bed. Running in the gym at 29th floor overlooking the city is a fantastic experience. Location is not very convenient unless you got a car, as we actually had. Parking is €20 per night, so we'be managed to find a free place to park (which seemed to be the only one place in the entire city :) ) just 100 meters from the entrance. The room is stylish, superclean and very comfortable. Castilla plaza and Santiago Bernabeu stadium are within the walking distance and are must visit places.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent luxury business hotel”
Reviews.Author: furcat
Reviews.Content: Friendly & helpful staff, great room with fantastic views, good food in the restaurant & very convenient for the British Embassy. I would definitely stay here again if on business in the area, but I would not choose this hotel for a tourist trip to Madrid as it's it a little way from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SFTripper
Reviews.Content: Tagged along on my husband's business trip. Location wasn't a problem since the Begona Metro Station is nearby, is easy to use and feels very safe - even at night - as long as you use the correct exit. I also walked around the area near the hotel alone at night looking for a place to eat dinner and felt very safe. There are a few good restaurants within walking distance if you take a right out of the hotel. Also good to know that taxis are much less expensive (12-13 Euro to the center) if you stay on the Paseo de la Castellana rather than taking the freeway (twice as much). Pros: Super modern, clean, very comfortable bed, unobstructed views, GREAT breakfast buffet, good internet connection, inexpensive cab ride to/from the airport (13 - 15 euro). Cons: No place in the hotel to buy water, tissues (none in room), newspaper, etc. No music player in the room. We would have appreciated some help or ideas from the concierge in terms of nearby places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel in Madrid... well almost in Madrid...”
Reviews.Author: fryfrye
Reviews.Content: The Eurostars hotel is a fantastic modern hotel located somewhat in-between the airport and the center of Madrid. The rooms are very modern -- almost like being in a top-end modern asian hotel. The rooms were very clean, the showers were fantastic (especially after a 8+ hour flight from the US). Room service was pretty decent -- you can take an extended walk from the hotel to a few shopping areas -- the walk will be much shorter once some construction is finished behind the hotel. All in all I will stay here next time I am in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel but location not the best for exploring.”
Reviews.Author: Emmagriff752
Reviews.Content: The hotel was obviously very new. Rooms and decor were lovely. Service was very good. The downsides were that the location was not in the centre of the city and so felt quite stranded and wasn't easy to go and find somwhere to eat in the evening etc this was made more of a problem because of the expensive food served in the hotels bar and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Tower of class”
Reviews.Author: Happyholidays81
Reviews.Content: What can one say about this lovely hotel. From the entrance to the fab top floor restaurant, super fast lifts(even thou can take time getting to you).We stayed in a suite which was everything you could hope for v big bed clean rooms, fab bathroom with heated floor. Even though this hotel is a bit out of the center and cost about 15 euro to get in to town everything else makes up for it with lovely views over madrid, first rate front desk there to help you anytime of the day. I have seen some bad reviews about this place and cant not understand them, its 5 star at its best so its not cheap but well worth it. :)

Reviews.Title: “Designed to look wonderful, but never actually tested for use”
Reviews.Author: InfinityTraveller
Reviews.Content: On the face of it, this is a new 5-star hotel which looks gorgeous. And it is indeed gorgeous. However, I'd never go there again. There are 3 classes of problem. 1. facilities - one small lounge-bar with seating for about 20 people to eat: not enough for a 28-floor hotel! - six lifts (elevators) for 28 floors. This results in long waits (several minutes sometimes) for a lift. - public areas are small and narrow (bar, lobby floors) due to the tall thin tower shape of the building. A lot of people can stay here, but they can't all use it at the same time. 2. room usability - the only full length mirror in the room is behind a low-hanging pendant light, and a bedside table, meaning you can't see yourself in it! (I've uploaded a picture of this). - the lighting (halogen downlighters) and the surfaces (black polished marble, black reflective glass) actually mean you walk into things because it's visually confusing! The public toilets on the lobby and bar levels caused almost everyone I spoke to to walk into the wall as they entered. - although free, the WiFi ran very slowly (less than 1Mb/s) and ceased to work completely on the afternoon of my 2nd day there - the sink in the bathroom was a free standing bowl with a mixer tap high above it. The result of this design is that everything, the floor, the mirror, your belongings and you, get wet if you even run the tap very gently, due to the large area of splashes this creates 3. location - it's in Madrid - but only just. It's in a peripheral, suburban area with no bars, restaurants or cafes that would cater to tourists, and non-Spanish speakers. It's about 7.5km from the city centre, which is a quite expensive taxi ride. There's a Metro station near-ish, but I guess you probably aren't thinking about public transport if you're staying in a 5-star hotel. Then there are little things, which even in 3-star hotels, you really expect. No box of tissues in the bathroom - just a plastic packet of 4 tiny tissues. A tiny folding ironing board which is awkward to use, and has to go on the desk, meaning you need to rearrange all the stuff the desk is already loaded with. (There's a picture of this). And not quite so little things. The TV is about 26". Small by modern standards and hard to see from the bed 10 ft away. There is no alarm clock or stereo or radio. Nothing to plug an MP3 player into. This is very unusual. The Hotel Arts, a 5-star place in Barcelona, has a Bang & Olufsen stereo and TV in every room. And every Hilton, Marriott, Crowne Plaza (etc.) that I stay at in the world always has a clock and a radio, and sometimes an MP3 speaker. Noise is also quite a problem, due to the hard wooden floors in the rooms. You can hear your next door and upstairs neighbours walking around, quite loudly, which isn't again what you expect in a 5-star hotel. Overall, the hotel is beautifully designed, and certain to be of interest to architects and architecture students. However, it's not practically usable by guests in my opinion, at least not as an expensive 5-star hotel, and in any case, it's location on the edge of the city near nothing in particular makes it fairly pointless. I can't see why it was built like this, here. Sadly, I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone, and I can usually find at least a few positive things to say about everywhere I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: ashokli
Reviews.Content: For my purpose, everything worked fine except for sleep. Typically, in Madrid dinners are late and I got to sleep late (compared to my normal life) and was up later in the morning. There seems to be constant banging and knocking and footsteps sounds. If there is a reason I will not come back, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...wow, I don't what else to say!”
Reviews.Author: Jetdriver21
Reviews.Content: Here's the bottom line, this hotel is one of the best hotels I've stayed at in the world. I don't put this stamp on just any hotel - I've been everywhere, but this one takes the cake. On a side note, I'm glad my company picked up the tab for this place. It's 5 star all the way, and normally I despise pretentious big luxury hotels, but I felt very welcomed and at home here. They created the perfect blend of style, class and hospitality. Which is hard to do when you get 5 stars. Hilton should take lessons. Reception is fast and friendly. The girls at the front desk will check you in and them pop open a map of the city and give you some insider tips of where to go and what to see and how to get there. Very helpful. The quiet elevator ride to the rooms opens up to a very modern and classy hallway. Very European in decor and very modern. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. They have everything from different mood light settings to pillow menus. The king bed provides a perfect nights sleep, the flatsceen TV on the wall has sat channels from around the world to cover many of the main European languages. The bathroom is to die for with a huge sink, tub and separate all encompassing jet shower. It's ridiculous. As for amenities in the hotel - there's too many to list, so here's the main ones. A sweet bar under the lobby, 2 beautiful restaurants on the top floor looking out over the city with breakfast included in the price. A spa and a gym. I think this hotel is great and hope I can stay here again. It was very impressive!

Reviews.Title: “Poor facilities and location”
Reviews.Author: BADGEREssex_UK
Reviews.Content: If visiting Madrid for a long weekend I would suggest you look elsewhere. As has already been stated , this hotel is well away from the centre and has little to do close by - a couple of restaurants and a McDonalds. Great views from the rooms especially the higher floors. Hotel is also very dark and modern, all black marble and mirrors. Staff are friendly but facilities very lacking for a supposedly 5* international hotel. There is no pool area to relax, no film channels on the TV and only 3 english speaking channels- Al Jazeera! , CNBC and BBC World News. Breakfast buffet very extensive but no hot choices - scrambled egg, bacon, sausage, mushroom and tomato from heated cabinets only. We ate at a restaurant called Casa Juan, a 10 minute cab ride - it was excellent especially the taster menu at 52 Euros including wine - almost never ending tapas dishes, plus main course and dessert. Also Casa Nemesia - a 5 minute walk and mainly fish. We took a train to Toledo (30 minutes) which is well worth a visit as an antidote to the modern cityness of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Standard 5*”
Reviews.Author: kriform
Reviews.Content: This is a standard 5* hotel. You get what you expect. Rooms are nice, especially appreciated the bed (I have back problems, so this comfortable bed was really a good thing for me). Food is fine, service is friendly and helpful. I was on a business trip and really appreciated the hotel. Although I would not recommend it for a tourist visit as Eurostars is relatively far away from city center. Subway is right next to the hotel, taxis are easily available but you still spend some time getting downtown. Overall a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I Will return...”
Reviews.Author: osvaldopuertorico
Reviews.Content: Located at the end of Paseo de La castellana, easy access to the center and airport. It is a 5 stars hotel recently built, with a good value for money, but of course, than the mninibar is so expensive¡¡¡ Coke 5 euros, parking 18 euros/day, breakfast 20 euros...etc I was in plant 23rd. At night someone knock on my door at 4am, another client has asked the “services” of a woman and she went to the wrong room, I was anger, it is not a nice situation and I couldn´t sleep more. The water temperature of the shower was cold and with low pressure, I advice to reception, and they resolved properly, it´s a pity that people don´t advise to the hotels when that happened, then it takes longer to resolve the problem, and the next guest have a bad service.

Reviews.Title: “26 floors up in an incredible room”
Reviews.Author: CPFCeagles
Reviews.Content: In one of the four towers in the north of the city. The actual hotel and my room was amazing- (like the Newsome room in the Silken Puerta America design hotel)- massive bed- bathroom separated by wooden panel to open or close. Amazing view. The staff were unbelievably helpful, excellent english. 3 free pcs that proved invaluable when searching for flights after mine to gatwick was cancelled- hence ending up at this hotel at last minute. Great bath, &shower too. Downside for me is the location to the centre and the air con was noisy at night- turned it off and then was hot and couldnt turn off noise from heated bathroom floor- at at 3 am couldnt be bothered to ask for help ! If you are a good sleeper and dont mind a metro ride to the centre it is a good deal here at the right price. Breakfast in room 27 e

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, spacious rooms, close access to Metro”
Reviews.Author: chachi07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and modern. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms very modern. The spa, although expensive, is very nice and we sat in the sauna/hot tub watching the sunset over the Madrid sierra. The hotel is in the upper Castellana Blvd. and far from the sites. However there's a subway station about 2 blocks from the hotel that provides quick access to the center of town. A cab to the center of town was about 12 euros. If you can get a cheap rate, like we did, and don't mind being away from the center of town I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: MSoca
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 days trip to Madrid, Spain. We stayed on the 8th floor, the view was amazing, the room was chic, eclectic and clean. The staff was attentive and always willing to help. The breakfast buffet was delicious...I will definately recommend this place to our friends and family. Great stay!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very suave, plush and sophisticated modern hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: citybreakcouple2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days with the wife a few months back. We both absolutely loved the hotel - it was very clean, spacious, and luxurious. The bathroom and bedroom were very spacious and done to a very high and modern standard. The hotel is a few minutes walk from a Metro station and from there it's about 25/30 mins to the heart of Madrid. For us, we were able to stay in top class accomodation whilst being able to travel around with the locals to get a real feel for the place. Can't fault it really - food was lovely too (yes maybe a tad expensive) but overall we loved it and would certainly recommend to fellow visitors. (ps Bayern Munich stayed here before the Champs League final - can it really be that bad???)

Reviews.Title: “Big tower, 5-star decor, good deal for rooms, great but $$$ breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Skooter22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is big and luxurious by any standard. The wall-to-ceiling mosaic bathroom tiles are beautiful and the room has very complicated but fun-to-play-with light settings. The rooms are standard 5-star hotel post-modern, which is stunning though not very cozy. Big bed, sitting chair and free internet. The breakfast, served on the top floor, is a buffet which spans the length of the restaurant, but costs 25 euros which is worth it if you don't want to leave the hotel in the morning as there's nothing else around. It was well worth the 80 euros per night, but you need a car there and parking is a little expensive. The staff was very kind, though my husband is a big tipper. Don't eat downstairs in the bar area--it smelled like cat pee. Black-out curtains for good sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel; problematic location”
Reviews.Author: Ishay27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand new, and it's obvious - rooms are extremely modern and comfortable. The views are beautiful (and I stayed in few numbers, so experienced all sides of the hotel, and they're all very nice). Complimentary internet is good. Breakfast is very good (though, when busy, they split guests into two dining rooms - a big and crowded one, and a smaller, quieter and more elegant one. However, they serve fewer dishes in the smaller one, which I just couldn't understand why. Also, they for some reason insist on serving the orange juice, and not having it on the buffet tables, which I thought was annoying). The gym on the top floor is a great experience with the view. Service was outstanding - it seems like so many work there, that there just waiting around the corner to ask if everything is ok, or even just say good morning. Everyone was over the top offering any assistance possible. Really impressive. But the location... the hotel is located outside of the city center, which means you need transport to anywhere (other than the McDonald's and hospital around the corner). But, there's a metro station very close by (a 5 minute walk), and at least one public bus that goes to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “3* Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimonKeen
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot on business and pleasure so this is based on having to live out of hotels often Rooms very modern and spacious.Bed comfortable. Lights annoying, several settings but have to turn off to switch settings. Can't find lights when entering room, the card slot is almost behind the door. Air con/heating good and very quiet. Bathroom Basin too small so soaks everything when I shave. Heated tiles when you find the controller. Shower would be great but no water pressure so too little water. Food - very poor! This is why it is not a 5 star hotel. Because of location there is not much else around. Room service menu very limited. Staff - the staff I met were pleasant and helpful. English not brilliant (except for the guy on reception who sounded dutch) but it is Spain and we should learn their language not expect them to speak ours. Internet very slow, seems to be limited to 756K per room. Prices in bar etc high, can of Guiness is €12 local beer €10. I think £10 for a Guiness is unacceptable. Location in northern business district not suitable for site seeing in Madrid. Taxi to Cuidad Financeria €30-€40 30-45 mins. I got very reasonable prices c€80 per night booked via internet which is very cheap but it was August which is cheaper is Madrid because everyone has left on holiday. Don't pay list price of €230. Overall a 3* hotel with nice rooms trying to be a 5* hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but a bit far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: KosmoK
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel with big rooms, huge bed, and nice bathroom. Great for business travel. Abundant breakfast buffet. I wouldn't stay here though if I wanted to tour around Madrid - it's too far from the city center (approx 15-20 minutes by metro or taxi).

Reviews.Title: “perfect modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: docya
Reviews.Content: First of all, all depends what you are looking for and if you are single, a couple or couple with kids. If you like modern style or you still prefer something classical; if you don’t mind to take a taxi or you prefer to stay in the centre. Depending on this you can judge. Madrid eurostar hotel is perfect hotel for a single traveller or a couple without kids. It is for people who like to be in a high-tech modern hotel with light asian style touch. If you like something like this- stay there and you wont regret. Room is beautiful, very nicely decorated, with separated space for bathtub and rain shower. View – on the city but you won’t see any famous monument. As I said- it is for people who love modern things. You should not be greedy if you stay in this hotel: spend 25 euro for a breakfast at hotel- it really worth it. We took taxi from the hotel to the centre of city, hotel will arrange a taxi within 3 minutes and a ride to the city costs around 10 euro. Cutting long story short: it is perfect modern hotel highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Family_in_MA_US
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at it this hotel many times over the past year. This is definitely one of the better business hotels in Madrid, with beautifully well-equipped rooms. Only knock is the location - given time the area may develop into something more interesting but right now the hotel is far from everything except the airport. Highly recommended for business travel. Note: there is construction outside the hotel but the staff were very helpful when I asked to switch rooms due to the noise. Ask for a room away from the construction if you are sensitive to noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business or Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: cararose1977
Reviews.Content: My husband's office booked this hotel for him and we liked it so much we decided to stay for the weekend. It is close to a subway station and (if you have a car) close to the highway. We had magnificent views of the countryside beyond the city. The bed was extremely comfortable and the shower system high-tech. The lighting system in the room was strange, but a minor complaint. Food in the restaurant, at the piano bar, and the breakfast buffet were all very good. There is a good seafood restaurant within walking distance as well.

Reviews.Title: “Towering stuff!”
Reviews.Author: Lynher
Reviews.Content: I was looking to book a hotel in Madrid to attend a conference. Eurostar Towers had excellent Tripadvisor reviews and I got a good offer on the website. I stayed there for 3 nights in April 2010. On arrival there I found the receptionist very friendly and helpful with useful advice on local eating joints, places to visit, transportation etc. I particularly wish to mention Jose, a young man at the desk who directed me to a wonderful tapas place. This hotel is very close (about 10 minutes walking distance) to Begona-pronounced Begonia- Metro station. I requested a room at the top and was allotted the 20th floor; I should also have specified looking towards the mountains rather than the road. The room was spacious, comfortable, clean, luxurious everything you expect in a 5-star hotel, well almost. The toilet seat in my room was wobbly and got wobblier as the days passed! I forgot to mention it to the reception but hoped the cleaning staff would notice and fix it which did not happen. Complimentary breakfast was served in a hall on the 30th floor with magnificent views of Madrid and neighbouring areas. This was a buffet service cooked and continental breakfast with a very wide and excellent choice of juices, fruits, cold meats, pastries, bread, cereals and hot food like eggs, sausages and bacon. However, the first day at breakfast was chaotic as the place was heaving with humanity. The waitressing staff on site were struggling to cope with trying to clear and lay tables and cutlery. There were no supervisory staff in the hall to regulate the numbers of guests pouring in. It was indeed a shambles; it was more a cattle market scene rather than breakfast room in a 5-star hotel! Apart from these blips my stay there was enjoyable. Just a note about transport in Madrid. They have a very extensive and excellent Metro system, which is very cheap, only € 1 for any trip. The trains are frequent, clean, well lighted, the stations clean and spacious not to mention talented resident buskers with South American bias. Sight-seeing trips on the open top buses especially the Madrid Vision route was interesting. Ask the reception for advice about good tapas eating places; stay clear off the obvious tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design, but NOT a 5-star service AT ALL. Very bad location.”
Reviews.Author: Waterfall84
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in summer 2009. I had to visit the city and wondered why not to visit the new towers in North Madrid. Ups: -Nice architecture and design, brand new, very clean. -Good price for a 5-star hotel in an European capital. Downs, everything else: - The staff is ABSOLUTELY unhelpful. People in check-in/reception area didn't help me with my luggage even if the lobby was completely empty and they just were chatting!! I couldn't believe I was in a 5-star hotel. Also, nobody came with me to show me the room and ask if everything was correct. - The woman in the check-in was totally unfriendly, the only question she made was "can I have your credit card!". Her English was terrible. For my experience, this is common in Spain. I can accept it in a family hotel in a rural area but this is a 5-star business hotel in Madrid. - Location way far from the city center. Totally avoidable for tourism.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AbigailDublin
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel from a long day at a trade fair in Barcelona and to snow and sleet in Madrid (it was not a good day). But this is the kind of hotel that will turn any bad mood around, the room is beautiful, the bathroom amazing and with the most fantastic shower and a bathtub. There is underfloor heating in the bathroom. Aside from the usual toiletries there was a gift box with more unexpected items such as tired leg gel, shaving foam, a lufa etc. I left for dinner and on my return I found my bed turned down with a note about tomorrows weather forecast and Godiva chocolates and a bottle of water and a whole plate of treats including chocolate dipped strawberries, truffles, blueberries and so on. Everything you'd expect from a 5 star and more..bathrobes, slippers, iron and board, tea and coffee facilities etc Very close to a metro stop, lovely breakfast, great staff. Would go back to Madrid just to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tower Views”
Reviews.Author: ProTravel99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights for business. Great hotel, ventrally located with all the mod cons. Good staff service and near the business hub. Great for business not so sure about holiday makers.

Reviews.Title: “Night in the sky”
Reviews.Author: fred3116
Reviews.Content: After an unpleasant stay, we booked for this nice place. Breakfast, dinner, bar, and of course the room with a view of the sky. To complete your stay, try the spa, the hydromassage. Que bueno!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rude personel”
Reviews.Author: Sariano
Reviews.Content: Rude people and a hotel that is in the middle of nowhere. There are much better hotels in Madrid. Try the Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Superb customer service and great modern touches in the room”
Reviews.Author: VisitorReading
Reviews.Content: The staff couldn't have been more helpful, and spoke perfect English. There were some great features in the room - the lighting styles, bath shutters, electric blinds etc. There were some things where design overcame practicality - but overall some great little touches to make the stay feel special. Superb choice of food at breakfast and great views from the 30th floor. Found the restaurant in the evening overpriced for the quality and presentation of the food - but I guess that's the same in most 5* hotels. Taxi about 12 euros into the city centre. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: gmarent
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good, i couldn't try any wellness, but everything seems to be new.

Reviews.Title: “Investor Summit”
Reviews.Author: NickiH3
Reviews.Content: Very interesting hotel. Great accommodation, food and service and fantastic meeting facilities. Would definitely stay there again. Its a business hotel though and not really for sightseeing in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for 5-star hotel; location just ok”
Reviews.Author: rar6621
Reviews.Content: We booked a special weekend promotional rate and we found it to be an excellent deal at 85 euros per night for this five-star hotel. About a 20 minute metro ride to the center of Madrid, but the metro is conveniently located a short distance from the hotel (metro is clean, safe and very well lit). Definitely high tech from phone, to lights to shower faucets -- more confusing and frustrating than useful..

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern Looking, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: AliYousaf19
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife were on our honeymoon and stayed here in this hotel during our 3 day stay in Madrid. Being our first time in Spain we really didn't know what to do, so the staff in particular a gentleman named Juan, helped us out a great deal. Pointed us in the direction of the best places to go for romantic evenings, flamenco, amazing food (probably the best part of Madrid is the food). However I would not get food from the hotel itself, very overpriced and there is a lot better food out in the city. Me and my wife ordered in breakfast one day and were not too thrilled about the food or price. However the overall stay at the hotel was great. Location is not too big a deal as the Metro goes all over the city, and there is a metro station very close (Begona).

Reviews.Title: “Impressive facilities but baaad service”
Reviews.Author: GlobalExpat
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night on a business trip. At check -in the people all looked (and acted) as if they all were trainees, they took a long time, mixed up the reservations, etc. DO NOT go to the restaurant for dinner in floor 30 as the service is terrible. It is impossible to get the waiter on your table, indeed we had to stand up and go searching for him in three ocassions. They also mixed up the dishes and didn't know what belonged to whom. The food was average. The rooms are super-modern and the views are nice, but me -and one colleague sleeping in a different room- were awakened in ht emiddle of the night but a strange an unidentified sound (it was as if something had left from the night table in the room). This happened two times during the night. A final nuisance (this one minor) was that when you take a shower the bathroom really floods. I reported this when checking out and they told me they know this problem (new hotel, you know). If management trains well its people this hotel has the potential to be a super hotel. Meanwhile I would spend the next year sleeping somewhere else when I go to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have to”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Traveller45
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, business district location, so only if you really need to. If you are on business I would check elswhere. Purely on the service levels. If you need anything other than a room not sure this this hotel works. Bar prices are London or New York. If it is busy with a conference, forget room service. If you ring to ask where it is they cancel your order. Apart from that good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent five star hotel and good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: ab500
Reviews.Content: Excellent five star hotel and good value for the money We went for our honey moon to Europe in June and I used tripadvisor.com as my guide to hotels in Europe. I saw this hotel on booking.com and I checked the reviews on tripadvisor.com . The hotel is a 30 story building located in the financial district of Madrid. We paid about 108 euro per night , which is good price for a five star in Europe. We were welcomed by a bottle of Champaign and sweets. The room was on the 17th floor with good view of Madrid. The room itself was very good as you can see on the website . Overall it was an excellent hotel , the staff were very helpful and could speak excellent English. It takes about 15 minutes from the airport and 25 Euros taxi fare. The only minor draw back was the hotel was located away from the city center . But , there are lot of taxi’s available outside the hotel and the train station is just 5 minutes walk from the hotel. I would definitely stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: giancarlodomingues
Reviews.Content: Eurostars Madrid Towers is a brand new Hotel, beautiful, modern and luxurious. Rooms are spacious (for european standards) and the bathroom is definitvely nice and equipped. It offers great views over Madrid, since it's a very high building in a high area. As drawbacks, eating at the hotel, even at the room, it's quite expensive, prices are up in the sky. The hotel offers a very convenient parking, but a valet service is not available, which should be present in a 5*hotel. It's a little bit away from city center, but if you're driving a car it's not a big problem and if you are not, I heard that public transportation is very close (subway, I think).

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view!!! Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Thousandeurist
Reviews.Content: It is truth. Among “madrileños” there is still some debate ongoing about how these skyscrapers fit within Madrid skyline. But you should go and judge by yourself to get it right. Views from my room in floor 25 were absolutely breathtaking. Decoration is quite cool, warm (everything in dark wood and grey) Classy and avant-garde at the same time. Room is huge, with plenty of space for storage and tea and coffee facilites available (not so usual for Spain, where this kind of stuff is not tradition) Everything you might expect for a high class hotel (from the flat screen to the spa toiletries), from the huge double bed to the intelligent control over the panoramic windows is present. And value for money is stunning: 110 Eur for a 5* hotel is something you don’t find that often in any European capital. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: JPP-Montreal
Reviews.Content: Nice huge business hotel. Somewhat pricey. Good food. Far from City centre.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel let down by an apparent deficiency of soundproofing!”
Reviews.Author: Gasker08
Reviews.Content: Our room, on the 27th floor, was breathtaking, with lovely views over Madrid. Rooms are large, extremely modern with wooden flooring throughout, air-conditioning Excellent range of TV channels on the flat screen. Lighting controls allow you to choose lighting to suit your mood. Bathroom is very comfortable - underfloor heating and multi-jet shower. You are given a delightful spa-box which contains every toiletry and bathroom utensil you could ever need. What let the hotel down for me is that there appeared to be very inadequate soundproofing between rooms - people walking across their floors and opening and shutting their cupboard/bathroom doors were all easily audible, which really spoiled things. This is simply not good enough in a hotel built at the end of the first decade of the 21st century. In addition, the queue for breakfast in the morning on the top floor was half an hour as everyone wants the panoramic views. The hotel should open up additional breakfast facilities. I would just about recommend this hotel to a friend, with the caveat that if they are easily disturbed by noise, they should not come here.
